sen.e: His name is written as "安萬侶" in "Kojiki" (The Records of Ancient Matters) and on his epitaph, but it is written as "太安麻呂" in other history books such as "Shoku Nihongi" (Chronicle of Japan Continued), "Koninshiki (one of Nihonshoki Shiki [The Private Record of Chronicles of Japan] written in the Konin Period)" and "Nihongi kyoen waka (The Poems at the Completion Banquet for the Lectures on Nihon Shoki)".
